perturbation.original_text: 8. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution. The terms of the Governing Law and Dispute Resolution provisions of the Distribution Agreement will apply to this Addendum.
perturbation.changed_text: 8. Governing Law and Dispute Resolution. The terms of the Governing Law provisions of the Distribution Agreement will apply to this Addendum. However, in the event of a dispute, resolution will be determined by mutual agreement between the parties, irrespective of the Distribution Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction regarding dispute resolution. The first part states the Distribution Agreement's dispute resolution applies, while the second allows for mutual agreement, nullifying the original agreement's terms and potentially violating requirements for clear dispute resolution processes.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General contract law principles requiring clarity and consistency in dispute resolution clauses; potential violation of jurisdiction-specific rules regarding mandatory arbitration if the original agreement specified it.

perturbation.original_text: 2. Purchase Order Rescheduling, Cancellation and Modification. Distributor has the right to cancel, reschedule or modify all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such cancellation or modification request is made within [*****] business days of PO acceptance or rescheduling request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Distributor has the right to change the destination of all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such change in destination request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Except as set forth above, purchase orders are non-changeable and non- cancellable by Distributor, once accepted by Xplore.
perturbation.changed_text: 2. Purchase Order Rescheduling, Cancellation and Modification. Distributor has the right to cancel, reschedule or modify all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such cancellation or modification request is made within [*****] business days of PO acceptance or rescheduling request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Distributor has the right to change the destination of all or any portion of a purchase order that has been accepted by Xplore at no cost to Distributor only if such change in destination request is made at least [*****] business days prior to the most current Estimated Shipping Date for that purchase order. Distributor retains the right to cancel or modify any purchase orders at any time for a fee of one dollar.
perturbation.explanation: The addition of the last sentence creates a contradiction. Initially, the purchase orders are non-changeable and non-cancellable except under specific time constraints, but after the change they can be cancelled or modified anytime for a fee. This introduces an ambiguity.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law: contradicting clauses regarding the ability to cancel or modify purchase orders.

perturbation.original_text: 5. Product Return and Stock Rotation. The terms of Section 3 of Schedule 2 of the Distribution Agreement will apply to Xplore Products, provided however that stock rotation allowance for Xplore Products will be based on the net dollar value of Distributor's purchases in each calendar quarter of Xplore Products and such allowance will be calculated separate and apart from all other Products purchased by Distributor during such period.
perturbation.changed_text: 5. Product Return and Stock Rotation. The terms of Section 3 of Schedule 2 of the Distribution Agreement will apply to Xplore Products, provided however that stock rotation allowance for Xplore Products will be based on the net dollar value of Distributor's purchases in each calendar quarter of Xplore Products and such allowance will be calculated separate and apart from all other Products purchased by Distributor during such period. Xplore holds sole discretion to accept product returns regardless of the agreement.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction. The initial statement clearly defines the terms for product return and stock rotation based on the Distribution Agreement and purchase value. However, the added phrase grants Xplore 'sole discretion' to accept product returns, effectively overriding and contradicting the previously stated, agreed-upon terms.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Breach of Contract: By granting itself sole discretion, Xplore contradicts previous agreements which would constitute a breach of contract.
